topics.body:
"@SquiggyBomb":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/54ff83836368725f75af1900#post_54ff83836368725f75af1900
Ok, so I didn't eat anything today, last time I ate was maybe when I ate dinner around 6 PM yesterday. Usually I can easily go without food for that long, and sure, I was feeling hungry, but I wasn't starving.

So Toski and I were going to the doctor's office for the first time since we've moved, and we got our check-ups as usual. 

(Apparently I'm between 5'6" and 5'7" which is actually a bit less than I expected, plus I'm not even 100 pounds which is definitely not what I expected, other than that I'm perfectly healthy, just small)

Afterwards, the doctor suggests we get a blood test for cholesterol and stuff like that, and our mom agrees, even when I'm telling her stuff like "I haven't eaten all day, I'm gonna pass out." I wasn't at all terrified of getting my blood drawn, but more so passing out afterwards, since getting my blood drawn makes me dizzy, coupled with the fact that I was especially low on nutrients without any food in my system.

So Toski went first, he was perfectly fine. Right before I stepped up though, I absolutely started crashing. My vision went completely black and fuzzy, and my hearing was muffled. I leaned up against a wall, but then I went completely weak and basically had to be held up by my mom. They sat me down for a good 10 minutes, I was absolutely pale for a while, and after that I was fine. 

So apparently I'm going back tomorrow to get it done instead of today. I really need to make sure I eat XD
topics.author: 9ba2e84e636164642cc03200
